Questions.question: Funtion of the thoracic cage include the following except
options: Protection of vital thoracic/ some abdominal organs
it resist  the negative internal pressure created by the elastic recoil of the lungs
it provides attactments for and support the weight of the upper limb
it provides attactment for the the muscles that move
all of the above
Questions.explanation:
Function of the thoracic cage includes 
 1. Protect vital thoracic and abdominal organs (most air or fluid filled) from external forces 
 2. Resist the negative(subatmospheric) internal pressures generated by elastic recoil of the lungs and inspiratory movements 
 3. Provide attactment for and support th weight of the upper limbs 
 4. Provide the anchoring attachmet (origin) of many of the muscles that move and maintain the position of the upper limbs relative to the trunk, as well as provide the attactments for muscles of the abdomen, neck, back, and respiration

Questions.question: which of the following is/ are true
options: The vertebrosternal ribs include the 1st,2nd and 3rd ribs
The vertebrochondral ribs include the 10th, 11th, and 12th ribs
The floating ribs include the 10th, 11th and 12th ribs
all of the above
none of the above
Questions.explanation:
There are 3 types of ribs namely 
 1. True (Vertebrosternal) ribs (1st to 7th ribs) 
 2. False (vertebrochondral) (8th - 10th) 
 Floating(Vertebral, free) ribs 
 (11th and 12)

Questions.question: The following are examples of typical ribs except
options: 4th rib
5th rib
8th rib
11th rib
12th rib

Questions.question: Examples of atypical ribs include the following
options: 1st rib
2nd rib
3rd rib
10th rib
12th rib

Questions.question: Concerning the 1st rib
options: It is the broadest and shortest of the true ribs
it has a dense facets for articulation with the vertebrae
It has a tubercle and ridge to which the scalene muscle is attached
all of the above
none of the above
Questions.explanation:
features of the first rib include 
 1. Flattened from above downwards 
 2. Shorteest, Broadest and most curved of all ribs 
 3. Head has just one facet for articulation with T1 
 4. Upper Surface has 2 grooves where the subclavian vessels lie . Between these grooves is the scalelen tubercule for attachment of anterior scalene muscle

Questions.question: Concerning the 2nd rib
options: It is more curved than the 1st rib
It has multiple facets  for articulation with the vertebra
It has a tuberosity for the attachment of serratus anterior
It has a tuberosity for attachment of scelene muscle
None of the above

Questions.question: The following are examples of atypical vertebrae except
options: First thoracic vertebra
Second thoracic vertebra
Tenth thoracic vertebra
Eleventh thoracic vertebra
all of the above
Questions.explanation:
Typical thoracic vertebra T2-T8
Atypical thoracic vertebra T1,T9,T10,T11,T12

Questions.question: The sternum
options: It is a flat and elongated bone
It protects the heart & mediastinal viscera
It has three parts manubrium, Body , Xyphoid process
The manubrosternal joint ossifies in late adulthood
all of the above
Questions.explanation:
The sternum is a flat and elongated bone. It protects the heart & mediastinal viscera. It has 3 parts which are 
 Manubrium 
 Body 
 and Xyphoid process. It has to joint 
The manubrosternal joint 
 2. The xyphisternal joint
The Xyphisternal joint ossifies in late adulthood

Questions.question: Which of the following is true about the Xiphisternal joint
options: It forms a midline marker for the superior limit of the diaphragm
It indicates the inferior limit of the central part of the thoracic cavity
It marks the central tendon of the diaphragm
It is midline marker for the inferior border of the heart
All of the above

Questions.question: The inferior thoracic aperture is formed
options: Anteriorly by costal cartilages
Posteriorly by the body of 12th thoracic vertebra
Posterolaterally by 11th and 12th pairs of ribs
Anterolaterally by the 6 to 8th ribs
all of the above

Questions.question: The following are true about the external intercostal muscles except
options: It consists of twelve pairs of muscles
It is most active during expiration
It elevates the ribs
It is supplied by intercostal nerve
It continues inferiorly with internal oblique muscle

Questions.question: Which of the following is true about the endothoracic fascia
options: It lines the thoracic cage externally
It is a thin fibro-areolar fascia
It forms supraplurral membranes over the apices of the lungs
It separates parietal plural from the thoracic wall
all of the above

Questions.question: Concerning the right lung
options: It is covered entirely by the visceral pleura
It is divided into two lobes by the oblique fissure
It is lighter than the left lung
It is shorter than the left lung
all of the above

Questions.question: which of the following statement is correct
options: The pulmonary ligament is inferior to the root of the lungs
The pulmonary ligament is derived from the pleural sleeves
The pulmonary ligament extends between the lungs and the diaphragmatic surface of the lungs
All of the above

Questions.question: Characteristices of bronchopulmonary segments include the following
options: It is sugically resettable
Usally 18-29 in number

It is separated from the adjacent segment by connective tissue septa
all of the above

Questions.question: Choose as appropriate
options: The bronchiles lack cartilages in their wall
The conducting brochioles do not have glands
The pulmonary alveolus is the basic structural unit of gas exchange in the lungs
New alveoli are formed before the age of 12 years
New alveoli are formed before the age of 24 years

Questions.question: Choose as appropriate, the lung is supplied by
options: Two pulmonary arteries and drained by two pulmonary veins
Two pulmonary arteries and drained by one pulmonary vein
One pulmonary artery and drained by one pulmonary vein
One pulmonary artery drained by two pulmonary veins
None of the above
Questions.explanation: The lungs is supplied by 1 pulmonary ARTERY and 2 Pulmonary vein

Questions.question: Choose as appropriate, the lung is supplied by
options: Vein form the visceral pleura drains into the systemic viens in the thorax

The parietal pleura is drained by systemic veins
all of the above

Questions.question: Which of the following is true about the bronchial vein
options: The right bronchial vein drains into azygos vein
The left brochial vein drains into hemi-azyos vein
The proximal part of the root of the lung drain into the brochial vein
esophageal vein drains into the braochial vein
all of the above

options: Thoracic duct
Lymphatic trunk
Thymus
Left recurrent laryngeal nerve
superior vena cava

Questions.question: The following except one are muscle of the thoracic wall
options: Serratus posterior
Levatores costarum
Levatores posterior
Transversus thoracis
Intercostal

Questions.question: Which of the thoracic muscle are fan-shaped and helps in elevating the ribs
options: Levatores costarum muscles
Intercostal
Subcostal
Transversus thoracis
Levatores posterior

Questions.question: Which of the following muscles occupy the intercostal space
options: Intercostal muscle
Subcostal muscles
Serratus posterior

Questions.question: The arterial supply to the thoracic wall are not derived from the following except
options: Thoracic aorta
Right carotid artery
Left carotid artery
Pulmonary artery
Common carotid artery
Questions.explanation: The arterial supply to the thoracic wall is by the posterior intercostal artery derived from the Thoracic aorta and anterior intercostal arteries which are branches of subclavius artery

Questions.question: The following thoracic muscles are innervated by the intercostal nerve except
options: Serratus posterior
Subcostal
Transversus thoracis
External intercostal
Internal intercostal

Questions.question: The following is true about the pericardium except

The serous pericadium is a single layer of flat cells
The visceral pericardium lines the inner layer of the fibrous pericardium
The parietal layer is also known as the epicardium

Questions.question: The following is not true about the heart
options: Blood leaves the right side of the heart via the pulmonary veins
The right ventricles is globular in shape
The right ventricle is thicker than the left ventricle

Questions.question: The following is true about the heart except
options: is a fibromuscular pumping engine
Pericarditis is inflammation of the heart muscles
Enlargement of the heart is cardiomegaly
Atria septal defect allows direct communication between the artium and the ventricle
Both atria receives arterial blood

Questions.question: Concerning the Mediastinum, the following may be false
options: It is bounded anteriorly by the ribs
It is bounded posteriorly by the costal cartilages
Extends vertically from the cricoid cartilage to the diaphragm

options: The apex of the heart is slightly directed to the right side of the body
The base of the heart faces posteriorly
The right border is formed mainly by the right atria wall

options: The left atrioventricular orifice is guarded by the tricuspid valves
The mitral valve guards the left ventricular outflow channel
The aortic valve cups are anterior, left posterior and right posterior
The function and structure of the heart valves can be assesed by Echocardiogram
Congenital cardiac malfuntions are very rare

The posterior suface is formed mainly by the atrium

options: Mainly via the bronchial and coronary artery

The left coronary artery is usually the dominant artery
The dominant artery gives the posterior interventricular artery
Coronary artery stenosis is a cause of angina pain

The thoracic duct transverse the arotic apeture of the diaphragm
The right lymphatic duct may open into the left internal jugular trunk
The thoracic duct usually have few valves especially close to its termination
none of the above

The anterior interventricular artery is a branch of the left coronary artery

options: Gives conus branch
Anterior interventricular artery is a branch

The circumflex branch is a continuation of the artery

Questions.question: Concerning the left coronary artery
options: The anterior interventricular artery is a branch
It gives of the right marginal artery
The great cardiac vein accompany the anterior interventricular artery
It may give of the diagonal branch
None of the above is true

It bifurcation is at the upper border of T10 vertebra a little to the right of midline
The isthmus of the thyroid gland attached to the 2nd to the 8th trachea ring
It is always a posterior relation to the oesophagus

Questions.question: The Oesophagus

It begins at the lower border of the cricoid cartilage at the level of the C8 vertebra
it is an anterior relation to the trachea throughout its length
It passes through the diaphragm 2.5cm to the left

The parasternal nodes is one of the lymphatic drainage of the thorax

In the posterior mediastinum, It is related anteriorly to the left main bronchus

The vena cava opening lies opposit T8 to the right of the midline
The azygous veins passes through the vena cava opening
The hemiazygous vein passes through the left Crus

Questions.question: Consider the following statement

options: An average adult heart is approximately 20cm from the base to the Apex

the heart is usually conical or PYramidal in shape

All of the above

Ductus arteriosus connect the right atrium to the left atrium
Ductus arteriosus is the fibrous remnant of the ligamentum arteriosum
The lung is active

Sternopericardial ligament
The descending aorta
Branch of the internal thoracic vessel
None of the above

Questions.question: The middle mediastinum
options: The anterior boundary is manubrium
It extends through the bodies of the first four thoracic vertebra

The fibrous pericardium fuses with the adventitia of the inferior vena cava
